extendedInfo.description: Your registration will not expire. Telephone numbers placed on the National Do Not Call Registry will remain on it permanently due to the Do-Not-Call Improvement Act of 2007, which became law in February 2008.The National Do Not Call Registry gives you a choice about whether to receive telemarketing calls. Most telemarketers	should not call your number once it has been on the registry for 31 days. If they do, you can file a complaint at this Website. You can register your home or mobile phone for free.

reviews.comment: What is the point they still keep calling me, and yes I am on the list. I might as well not be for all the good it is doing me. How about you stop cal
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: NDNCL
reviews.comment: works great used it on 4 lines... samsung galaxy 4 g touch
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Opens the DO NOT CALL Registry,
reviews.comment: But, it\'s way small, and there is no Android integration, does not link to call log, just a browser page. I hope the dev adds some \"Android\" features.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not necessary
reviews.comment: This app gives no benefit over using the DNC website from my browser.  Just set a bookmark.  It could make things larger so it\'s easier to enter info, and save history info and recurring data, but it doesn\'t.
reviews.author: Carroll Savage

reviews.title: Broken
reviews.comment: Samsung galaxy blaze- app does not work, nor does the website at least on mobile. Cannot enter phone number to add to list, keeps glitching
reviews.author: A Google User
